title: Project Planning and Requirements Gathering
description: Define the project scope, goals, and requirements. Collaborate with stakeholders and subject matter experts to understand needs and constraints for the knowledge graph visualization tool. This task includes creating a detailed project plan, outlining system architecture, defining technical specifications, and detailing user interface/user experience design considerations.

title: Architecture Design
description: Design the overall system architecture, including the data model, user interface, and backend components. Define the technology stack and integration points.

title: Knowledge Graph Data Modeling and Database Selection
description: Design the data model for representing the knowledge graph, including entities, relationships, and associated metadata. The data model should support efficient storage, retrieval, and querying of the knowledge graph data, considering factors such as scalability, performance, and data integrity. This includes selecting a suitable database technology that can handle complex data structures and provide good querying capabilities for this purpose. Additionally, specify the schema design and normalization strategy to optimize the storage and retrieval of large amounts of data expected. Consider using a graph database like Neo4j or Amazon Neptune for their ability to efficiently handle complex relationships and queries. Include a brief rationale for the chosen database technology. Also, discuss the potential trade-offs and limitations of this choice. Furthermore, provide an outline of the data modeling process with milestones and expected timeline.

title: User Interface Design for Interactive Knowledge Graph Visualization Tool
description: Design an intuitive and efficient user interface for the knowledge graph visualization tool, ensuring ease of navigation, effective query formulation, and meaningful interaction patterns. Consider edge cases, accessibility, performance optimizations, adherence to design principles, and responsive design. Incorporate feedback from potential users (if available) into the design process. This RFC is ready for review by the code-architect and suggests further iterations with frontend-developer for detailed wireframes or mockups. Also, consider the impact on mobile devices and optimize designs accordingly.

title: Backend Development
description: Implement the backend components, including the knowledge graph data store, query processing, and API endpoints.

title: Frontend Development
description: Implement the user interface for the knowledge graph visualization tool, including rendering, interaction, and integration with the backend.

title: Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Plan and execute testing strategies, including unit tests, integration tests, and user acceptance testing. Ensure the application meets quality standards and requirements.

title: Security and Compliance
description: Assess and mitigate security risks, implement access controls, and ensure compliance with relevant regulations and standards.

title: Deployment and DevOps
description: Set up the deployment infrastructure, automate the build and release processes, and configure monitoring and logging.

title: Documentation and User Support
description: Create comprehensive documentation for the application, including user guides, technical documentation, and support resources.
